item.title: Isoprene Aerosol Growth in the Upper Troposphere: Application of the Diagonal Volatility Basis Set to CLOUD Chamber Measurements
item.description:
Nirvan Bhattacharyya, Brandon Lopez, Jenna DeVivo, Douglas M. Russell, Jiali Shen, Eva Sommer, João Paulo A. Almeida, A. Amorim, H. Beckmann, M. Busato, Manjula R. Canagaratna, Lucía Caudillo, Anouck Chassaing, T. Christoudias, Lubna Dada, Imad El Haddad, Richard C. Flagan, Hartwig Harder, Bernhard Judmaier, Milin Kaniyodical Sebastian, J. Kirkby, Hannah Klebach, Markku Kulmala, Felix Kunkler, Katrianne Lehtipalo, Lu Liu, Bernhard Mentler, Ottmar Möhler, Aleksandra Morawiec, Tuukka Petäjä, P. Rato Mendes, Birte Rörup, Samuel Ruhl, Wiebke Scholz, Mario Simon, António Tomé, Yandong Tong, Jens Top, Nsikanabasi Silas Umo, Rainer Volkamer, Jakob Weissbacher, Douglas R. Donahue, ACS ES&T Air. None(None)] 2025. https://openalex.org/W4414203041

item.title: Roadmap for Transforming Heterogeneous Catalysis with Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
Hongliang Xin, John R. Kitchin, Núria López, Neil M. Schweitzer, Nongnuch Artrith, Fanglin Che, Lars C. Grabow, G. T. Kasun Kalhara Gunasooriya, Heather J. Kulik, Teodoro Laino, Suljo Linic, Andrew J. Medford, Randall J. Meyer, Jiayu Peng, C. B. Phillips, Jin Qian, Long Qi, Wendy J. Shaw, Zachary W. Ulissi, Siwen Wang, Xiaonan Wang, No host. None(None)] 2025. https://openalex.org/W4414268454
Artificial intelligence (AI) is poised to transform heterogeneous catalysis, ushering in a new paradigm for catalytic materials discovery. By uncovering intricate patterns in high-dimensional data, AI has been reshaping our pursuit of sustainable catalytic processes across the energy, environmental, and chemical sectors. This promise, however, hinges on overcoming fundamental barriers including limitations in data availability and quality, challenges in the generalizability and interpretability of data-augmented decisions, and the persistent gap between in silico predictions and experiments. In this Perspective, we outline a forward-looking roadmap for deeply integrating AI into heterogeneous catalysis with an AI-ready data ecosystem, multimodal foundation models, and ultimately agentic future labs to accelerate the development of next-generation catalytic technologies via AI-empowered human–machine collaboration.
item.author: Hongliang Xin, John R. Kitchin, Núria López, Neil M. Schweitzer, Nongnuch Artrith, Fanglin Che, Lars C. Grabow, G. T. Kasun Kalhara Gunasooriya, Heather J.
